definitions.definition: (sometimes in the plural) The remains of a destroyed or dilapidated construction, such as a house or castle.
The state of being a ruin, destroyed or decayed.
definitions.example: The monastery has fallen into ruin.

definitions.definition: Something that leads to serious trouble or destruction.
definitions.example: Gambling has been the ruin of many.

definitions.definition: A change that destroys or defeats something; destruction; overthrow.
definitions.example: the ruin of a ship or an army;  the ruin of a constitution or a government;  the ruin of health or hopes

definitions.definition: To cause the fiscal ruin of.
definitions.example: With all these purchases, you surely mean to ruin us!

definitions.definition: To destroy or make something no longer usable.
definitions.example: He ruined his new white slacks by accidentally spilling oil on them.

definitions.definition: To cause severe financial loss to; to bankrupt or drive out of business.
definitions.example: The crooked stockbroker's fraudulent scheme ruined dozens of victims; some investors lost their life savings and even their houses.

definitions.definition: To upset or overturn the plans or progress of, or to have a disastrous effect on something.
definitions.example: My car breaking down just as I was on the road ruined my vacation.

definitions.definition: To make something less enjoyable or likeable.
definitions.example: I used to love that song, but being assaulted when that song was playing ruined the song for me.

definitions.definition: To reveal the ending of (a story); to spoil.
To fall into a state of decay.
To seduce or debauch, and thus harm the social standing of.
definitions.example: The young libertine was notorious for ruining local girls.
